A server belongs to a cluster (specified by a + * {@code ClusterSpec}), and corresponds to a particular task in a named job. + * The server can communicate with any other server in the same cluster. + * + *

WARNING: A {@code Server} owns resources that must be + * explicitly freed by invoking {@link #close()}. + * + *

Instances of a {@code Server} are thread-safe. + * + *

Using example: + * 

+ * {@code
+ * ClusterDef clusterDef = ClusterDef.newBuilder()
body: I think I can't do it because `ClusterDef`, `JobDef` etc. are classes from `org.tensorflow::proto`, not from this package.
